item.title: Report X-2024081948
item.description:
Report X-2024081948

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3800
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/27/2024, the BNSF Los Angeles hub personnel reported Unit ESTU 500350 (Waybill Hazardous) as leaking a substance from the middle of the container that did reach the ground after unit de ramped from a train. Unit was taken to the Hazmat Pit for safety. On the behalf of the shipper, approved contractor United Pumping was contacted and dispatched to complete inspection. Interior inspection revealed palatized cases, palletized gallon drums and 2 IBC Totes of Sulfuric Acid in 2 rows, stacked 2 high in the nose throughout the container. Source of the leak was determined to be 2 IBC Totes in the middle of the unit. The cause for the Leak was determined to be 2 IBC Totes appeared to have a pre existing creases near the top that caused the totes plastic to break, creating package failure contributing to the material leak. Total quantity of leaked liquid was approximately 10 gallons of product, 5 gallons from each IBC Tote.

  • City: LEWISTON

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024081821 Sort manager brought package over to the QA dept due to the closures being open and discovered two packages labeled as a class 2 dangerous goods non-flammable gas were inside the package. The outer packaging gave no indication there were two inner items with UN 3164 Articles, Pressurized, Pneumatic item. It appears this is an undeclared hazmat. No spill or damage to the items is observed. 2. X-2024081822 Sort manager brought package over to the QA dept due to the closures being open and discovered two packages labeled as a class 2 dangerous goods non-flammable gas were inside the package. The outer packaging gave no indication there were two inner items with UN 3164 Articles, Pressurized, Pneumatic item. It appears this is an undeclared hazmat. No spill or damage to the items is observed.

  • Description: Unmarked box found leaking on delivery truck during AM sort. Box removed from vehicle and inspected. Inner box found to have Class 8 diamond and UN2794 markings with Pb battery. Due to no directional arrows or hazmat markings on the outer box, package had been transported on conveyor system and loaded sideways causing battery to spill. Packing slip on side of outer box only lists item as Battery Start 12V

  • City: ANCHORAGE

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPS DELIVERED A REGULATED DG PACKAGE TO ALASKA AIRLINES ON 8/19/24 FOR TRANSPORT TO NOME, ALASKA. ALASKA AIRLINES RETURNED THE PACKAGE TO UPS ON 8/20/24 BECAUSE THEY OBSERVED WETNESS ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS BY A UPS DESIGNATED RESPONDER DISCOVERED (3) 1 LITER BOTTLES OF ALCOHOL.(1) BOTTLE HAD LEAKED DUE TO THE CAP LOOSENING DURING TRANSIT. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED WITHOUT CUSHIONING OR CONTAINMENT MATERIALS. THE TAPE/SHRINK WRAP SEALING THE SCREW ON CAPS HAD FAILED TO KEEP ONE OF THE CAPS TIGHT IN TRANSIT.

item.description:
Report I-2024080107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: Anchorage
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: TOTE MARITIME ALASKA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 18, 2024, TAG inspected trailer V 007244, booking SEA 1049003. This load sailed NB on the Midnight Sun Voyage 24129 that departed Tacoma on 8/14/2024. Upon inspecting it, TAG found undeclared hazardous items of 3 boxes of UN0012 Cartridges for Weapons, Inert Projectile and 4 boxes of UN0012 visible labeled limited quantity marked Cartridges for weapons both items are Class 1.4S explosives. There were other hazardous products in the trailer that were a Class 4.1 Flammable Solid which creates an incompatibility with the 1.4S explosives. The trailer was placarded as 4.1 and should have been placarded as Class 1.4S and segregated from the 4.1 product. Once discovered an updated Manifest was requested and trailer placarded correctly.

  • Description: On August 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrochloric acid was punctured by a skid and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the hydrochloric acid-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On August 15, 2024. four (4) 1-gallon containers of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel collected four (4) damaged 1-gallon containers of paint and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. All paint (UN1263) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon container

  • Description: Railroad employee observed fresh liquid on the exterior of UTLX 662597 while switching the track. Car was isolated and a response contractor was called to investigate and repair the car. Contractor mounted the car and observed the manway nozzle gasket protruding unusually from the seat of the manway lid. Contractor opened the manway and noted the nozzle gasket was deteriorated and misaligned on the nozzle causing the release. A new nozzle gasket was installed and the manway was properly secured.

Undeclared hazmat found: 3 Cans of KILZ Original all Weather Sealer and Severe Stain blocker -Flammable Liquid and Vapor, 1 gallon each 2 Aerosol Cans of KILZ Upshot Interior Primer Overhead Stain Sealer - Extremely Flammable Liquid and Vapor, 10 ounces each 2.   • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0925hrs on July 17, 2024, Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CPKC) Railroad's Hazmat Department received notice of a possible hazmat leak in its East St. Louis Yard. Hazmat mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders identified PROX 32954 (residue ANHYDROUS AMMONIA car) as the source of the leak. The vapor valve was found slightly opened, and the vapor valve's secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Responders closed the valve and secured the plug. Air monitoring confirmed the leak to be mitigated. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best Information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 07/15/2024, during cruise phase of flight DL 165 (AMS-MSP), a passenger's vape pen was observed to be smoking. Water was applied to the device and was placed in a fire containment bag. The smoke from the vape pen was mitigated. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No flight crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FM were notified.

  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a trailer loading operation at Veolia's 10-day in-transit facility in Port Allen, Louisiana, an employee observed a small puddle of liquid on the ground beneath a recently moved pallet. Upon closer examination, it was discovered that one of the drums on the pallet had sustained a minor gash near its base. The leak was estimated to be approximately half an ounce of liquid. The spill was immediately addressed using oil-dry absorbent material, and the damaged drum was safely transferred into an overpack container to prevent further leakage.

item.description:
Report X-2024081275

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill & Exposure. Hazmat. Leaking box, loss of 0.5 gal from 4x1gal plastic bottles Ecolab 6118111 Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid. Package Handler Essi Akota's leg was exposed and she felt a burning sensation while unloading. No further reaction to corrosive. Improper load orientation of the box on the bottom of wall in trailer FEDZ 557696 was noted; safety seals below caps corroded. 2 other boxes impacted by spill: TRK 278369646929 and 278010916733. Please see attached scan of Hazmat Incident Form completed at time of incident.

item.title: Report X-2024081687
item.description:
Report X-2024081687

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE INPUT. WEARING FULL PPE, AND WITH DECISION TREE RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING PACKAGE. USING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER WAS LED TO THE CORROSIVE SOLIDS OR LIQUIDS HAZARD CLASS RESPONSE SHEET. TORE OFF 5 INCHES OF PH TAPE AND COULD NOT DEICPHER IF THE TAPE WAS BLUE BECAUSE THAT WAS ALSO THE COLOR OF THE SPILLED LIQUID. RESPONDER STILL USED SODIUM BICARBINATE UNTIL IT RESULTED IN NEUTRAL PH TAPE. THEN CLEANED THE SPILL AND TRANSFERED IT TO THE DMP WHERE RESPONDER COMPLETED THE REST OF THE CLEANUP DMP PROCESS.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1710 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) quarts of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon OP drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080597
item.description:
Report E-2024080597

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: CURTIS BAY
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRIUMVIRATE ENVIRONMENTAL, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During in-transit storage/transfer operations, material handler was staging waste for transportation. Using a foklift to move pallets of material, fork lift fork punctured the drum of waste, while waste was staged in transport trailer. Material handler immediately placed damaged drum on its side, so that the hole was facing upwards and preventing further material from being released. Spill response material was obtained from near by spill kit (sorbent sausage, pads, speedi dry [kitty litter]) and placed to collect the free liquid and prevent migration. Damaged drum was over-packed into salvage drum and used absorbent material was containerized for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080441
item.description:
Report E-2024080441

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NRC ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was taking load to PRS (Disposal Facility) when he noticed the smell of diesel when he entered the facility. When he looked back, he noticed that he could see liquid coming from the black valve on top of the tanker. PRS directed him to park in an area to contain the potential release. Once the driver pulled over, he called the ER team who was dispatched to investigate the roadway for the release and clean any impact at PRS. When the ER response team arrived at the area, they discovered no product on the roadway and only staining in the driveway and parking area of PRS. The disposal facility took responsibility of the product clean up. Based on the teamâ€™s findings it was determined the release to be well under 5 gallons. The source of the release was deemed to be the valve on top of the tank. The tank was emptied at the disposal facility and washed out. It was taken back to the yard where the vehicle was red tagged. The valve has since been replaced.

item.title: Report E-2024060113
item.description:
Report E-2024060113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T00:45:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: CREOLA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 4
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL AT CONSIGNEE LOCATION OFFLOADING OPERATIONS STARTED. DUE TO A SLIGHT LEAK AT THE EXTERNAL VALVE CONNECTION CONSIGNEE PERSONEL REJECTED LOAD REQUIRING REPAIR AT OFF-SITE LOCATION. DRIVER PROCEEDED TO REPAIR FACILITY FOR ASSISTANCE. AT EVENT LOCATION, CTMV WAS BROUGHT TO DOORWAY OF REPAIR FACILITY DUE TO WEATHER CONDITIONS. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ASSIST MECHANICS BY REMOVING EXTERNAL VALVE FROM HOUSING. ONCE VALVE REMOVED FROM PIPE PRODUCT FLOWED FREELY INTO ENVIROMENT. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ACTUATE EMERGENCY SHUTOFF. ACTIVATION OF EMERGENCY SHUTOFF FAILED TO STOP FLOW OF PRODUCT. FACILITY EVACUATED DUE TO PRODUCT RELEASE AND INABILITY TO HAULT FLOW FROM TRAILER. VAPOR CLOUD RESULTED FROM PRODUCT FUMES AND WET WEATHER AT TIME OF INCIDENT. DRIVER SUFFERED CHEMICAL BURNS DURING ATTEMPT TO REMOVE VALVE AND HAULT FLOW, WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL. INTERNAL INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY CAUSE OF FAILURE AT THIS POINT APPEARS TO BE INTERNAL VALVE SEATING WHICH PREVENTED PROPER OPERATION OF INTERNAL VALVE SEALING VESSEL. SUPPLIMENTAL REPORT WILL BE FILED WITH ADDITIONAL DETAILS.

item.title: Report X-2024081589
item.description:
Report X-2024081589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/19/2024 at approximately 2100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3667328 at the station in Portland, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of a polystyrene package, containing various food items packed on wet ice, along with two plastic containers of "Multi-Clor". The outer packaging appeared to colapse under the weight, exposing the shipment's contents. An online safety data sheet, retrieved by Dangerous Goods Administration, classified "Multi-Clor" as UN 1791 Hypochlorite solution. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it was not completed with the required markings, labeling, packaging or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024081608
item.description:
Report X-2024081608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA with visible leakage and a strong odor. Upon further inspection it is revealed that the drum had a loose lid/ seal failure leading to the spill, we believed it to be non hazardous at first. We had to reach out to the shipper to get the SDS which caused the initial delay in the DPR, however when provided the transport section did not have any information about it being hazardous, but we suspected it being hazardous because of the SDS chemical composition as well as the GHS classifications listed. We processed the DPR and ISF and asked for an updated SDS from the shipper and the delay from then to filling out an incident report was because the shipper sent us an SDS with the transport information today, however the SDS itself seems to have some conflicting items as it is classified as non hazardous but a UN#, class, as well as packing group were provided right below , it also has acute toxicity NFPA label and a skull and crossbones GHS label but no other information in the transport section about them. The proper shipping name I entered is what I found on the ERG however one was not provided on the SDS. I will include both SDS's for reference.

  • Description: Yard personnel reported ice buildup on the exterior of the protective housing and a strong odor behind the car. Code 3, contractor, was dispatched and upon arrival found the liquid valve open and the plug less than tool tight, resulting in liquid spraying out and freezing. A large chunk of ice was noted on the valve and housing walls. The valve was closed, the plug retefloned and then properly secured with no other issues found. The car continued in transportation after the ice melted off.

  • Description: Crewmember was sitting in a seat charging his cell phone using a battery pack. The crewrnember said that he noticed that the battery pack started swelling then there were sparks and flames. The crewmember threw the pack into the seat next to him. The other crewmembers used the fire extinguisher to put out the flames. There were 12 thru passengers on the flight that were instructed to deplane. Maintenance came on and replaced the seat.

  • Description: Drums were positioned on pallets and loaded into the trailer by the generator. During the loading process, a small crack was sustained on the bottom of one drum from either the tip of a forklift, the corner of a pallet, or other drum pressing against it. The leak was not evident during the loading process or on the post-trip inspection on 7/25/24. The leak was identified while the drum was still on the trailer on 7/26/24. The spill was cleaned up by in-house staff and the original container was overpacked along with the spill clean up residual.

Upon inspection I found 4 one gallon jugs of Reagent Alcohol which all had lids that were tightened down and all containers were in good condition. 1 of the 4 containers visibly had less contents than the other 3. The reason for damage is unknown. It is unknown how the package failed and what failed on the package.

item.title: Report E-2024080572
item.description:
Report E-2024080572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 20, 2024, at 1040 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Livermore, California regarding the release of f ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 3 gallons of ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) 20-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 26ft x 2ft area of the trailer floor and a 12ft x 1ft area of concrete beneath the trailer. The damaged drum of residual product was placed in a 55-gallon overpack with absorbents. Contractors then neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 55-gallon DF overpack and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024080557

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 19, 2024, at 1617 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Union Gap, Washington regarding the release of Transchem Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 2 gallons of Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid Solution, 8, II) from a box containing (4) 1-gallon plastic pails. The release was due to a load shift and impacted a 6ft x 6ft area on the trailer floor and the outer boxes of other cargo. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Thirty-four 1-gallon plastic pails of recovered product were collected and containerized in (2) 55-gallon DFâ€™s. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 55-gallon DF, then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081596
item.description:
Report X-2024081596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PD 7 SUPERVISOR CALLED WITH A LEAKER OUTSIDE OF DOOR 175, RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND DECISION TREE THE PACKAGE WAS SITTING UP RIGHT ON THE CATWALK OF DOOR 175 WITH ONE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE WET FROM INTERNAL LEAKING. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND RETURNED IT TO DMP. WHERE IT WAS DISCOVERED THE LID ON ONE OF THE FOUR 1 GALLON CONTAINERS INSIDE WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING IN THE BAG. WHICH INTURN WAS SATRURATING THE OUTER CARDBOARD BOX AND CAUSING IT TO FAIL. THE FOUR GALLONS WERE THEN PLACED IN A GENEROUS LAYER OF ZEPZORB AND SUBMITTED AS A LIQUID SINCE WE HAD OVER 3 GALLONS OF LIQUID.

  • Description: On August 14, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed a neutralizing agent, then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN2922 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the transfer of a 551A1 container filled with liquid, oil-based white paint (overpacked into an 851H2) from the customer's storage facility to a Veolia box truck, an incident occurred. As the drum, weighing over 600 pounds, was being positioned onto a pallet inside the Veolia box truck, a leak was detected. To prevent the drum from slipping and potentially injuring personnel, it was promptly secured on the pallet. However, approximately one gallon of the waste material escaped from the drum, contaminating both the pallet and the box truck's floor. The cause of the leak remains unclear, as the drum's position did not seem to be a contributing factor. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the inner container was missing its bung, which may have played a role in the unexpected release of the waste material.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 13, 2024, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN17914 was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected one (1) 30-gallon pail of hypochlorite solution into one (1) 55-gallon over pack poly drum. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the hypochlorite solution and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. On August 19, 2024, EWI returned to the site to process the request to transfer the hypochlorite solution material into a closed top drum. EWI transferred the hypochlorite solution from the damaged 30-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 30th, 2024, at 09:48, personnel at the CSXT Avon Terminal, Avon Indiana, discovered UTLX 950697, a residue tank car which last contained Butadienes, Stabilized, leaking from the vapor. The car was isolated and the shipper was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-07-30-00096). CSX Hazardous Material Team Managers found the source of cause of release was the vapor line valve not fully closed and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. It was also noted that two other secondary securement plugs were less than tool tight. CSX personnel closed the valve and properly secured all secondary closures. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Tim B. Langford, Shell Chemical, 504-208-8193)

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/21/2024 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 9327095 at the Ground facility in Fairfield, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of four (4) 1-gallon containers packaged together in one fiberboard box. The package appeared damp on its topside. Further investigation revealed the inner containers, marked to match the label on the outside of the package, identifying the commodity as Xylenes, a fully regulated dangerous goods commodity. The shipment adorned no other markings, labeling, or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • City: OXNARD

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Patrick Mier CHECKER/DRIVER REG called safety to report a HazMat spill in trailer 556479 UN2692, BORON TRIBROMIDE, 8 (6.1), PG I, POISON-INHALATION HAZARD ZONE B. Patrick stated he found the 4lbs box in the nose of the trailer and stated it looked like the box was crushed by other freight in transit . Patrick stated he was not to sure if the product was still in the container in the box or if it had leaked out in the trailer. Safety advised Patrick to stay clear of the box and the trailer until a team could arrive to assist with the spill. Patrick stated the trailer was empty and the box was on e of the last of the freight on the trailer. Patrick stated he set the box down on the table outside the trailer and will send a photo to safety. Patrick stated he does not know if anything in on the trailer floor and did not feel comfortable going back in the trailer.

  • Description: During sort operations at the MSPA location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a glass bottle packaged with styrofaom molds top and bottom. The glas bottle was broken and all contents spilled inside of the fiberboard box. A packing slip inside identified the contents as dimethyl sulfoxide as a UN2810. There were no DG markings or paperwork on the outside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

  • City: DORAL

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, ONE BLACK SHRINKED WRAPPED WOODEN SKID SHIPPING AIR CARGO SERVICE TO COLOMBIA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS. DURING THE SCREENING PROCESS WHILE CUTTING THE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING, SEVERAL BOXES WERE FOUND WITH CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. OTHER BOXES WERE FOUND WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS OF THESE BOXES FOUND NUMEROUS FLAMMABLE PERFUMERY PRODUCTS. THE FREIGHT WAS OFFERED FOR AIR TRANSPORTATION TO UPS AIR CARGO WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING. THERE WAS NO INDICATION ON THE AIR WAYBILL THAT DANGEROUS GOOD PRODUCTS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENT NAME AND CITY ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS ALSEATRANS US, 1665 NW 102ND AV, SUITE 108, MIAMI FL, 33172, US. THE SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS MSL INTL GROUP, LLC, 1665 NW 102ND AV, MIAMI FL US.

item.title: Report E-2024080503
item.description:
Report E-2024080503

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: USPS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS. OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH SEVERAL AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT OF THE BOX. IT APPEARS THE CAPS OF ONE OR MORE OF THE AEROSOL CANS HAD COME OFF EXPOSING AND ENGAGING THE NOZZLE RELEASING THE PRODUCT INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE BEGAN TO DETERIORATE AND ULTIMATELY BROKE OPEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER USPS BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE TRAILERED INTO THE UPS ROCKFORD FACLITY AND WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING PRIOR TO FLIGHT ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a loose lid on one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The loose lid was hand tightened and wiped clean with absorbent rags and then shipped onto the consignee. Clean Habor's personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and the spent absorbents were gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with some impacted cardboard and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Customer in 36F Approached the aft lav and informed us that his cell phone charging unit battery"had expanded and broke out of the case". I asked him to bring it to us while I retrieved the TCB. He brought it to the cdt galley where FA Vanak took pictures and went to the front to share them with the purser and captain. I placed the unit temporarily in the TCB without breaking the seal awaiting further instructions and checking the eFAOM. The unit was not hot or Ieaking. The Captain looked at the pictures and advised us to place in the TCB and monitor. I did so for the remaining 40 mins or so. We returned the battery to the passenger upon deplaning and advised him to dispose of it properly. We were advised by MX that since we did not need to break the seal on the zipper Of the TCB it could be returned to its stowed position.

The spill was contained by dock associates. SEFL Safety was contacted, and contacted Hazmat 1 spill response. E3/OMI arrived on site at approximately 9:15. The team accessed the situation& proceeded with the clean up process. Clean up was complete at approximately 13:30. In total 10-55 gallon drums were used to contain the waste.E3/OMI will return to pick up the waste drums at a later date, once approval has been received.

item.title: Report X-2024081406
item.description:
Report X-2024081406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: READING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell contacted safety to report that trailer 572156 caught on fire while on the 241/RDG yard. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell stated that after ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck arrived at 241/RDG the lead trailer 572156 started smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry S chreck advised that after he arrived at 241/RDG he was about to unhook his set when he noticed the lead trailer 572156 was smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that he then proceeded to disconnect rear trailer 500713 and converter gear 71708 from the lead trailer. ABF Road Driver Terry Sch reck advised that he then proceeded to move trailer 572156 to the middle of the yard before he disconnected the trailer from tractor 13383. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that after he disconnected trailer 572156 from the tractor the Reading Fire Department arrived on scene. Deputy Chief Glor e of the Reading Fire Department advised that he believes a pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries shifted during transit. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the battery post may have contacted metal causing them to arc igniting a pallet of writing pens that were incased in carboard that was loaded underneath the pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the Reading Fire Department was able to put the fire out and made sure no drains or waterways were impacted. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell advised he will send photos of the damage to safety. Safety contacted CURA and sp oke with Cameron Kerr to conduct cleanup procedures.

item.title: Report I-2024070103
item.description:
Report I-2024070103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEMONT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer was loaded at Rowell in Willow Springs on 06/20/2024 with hydrochloric acid 28% and parked for the next day's delivery. On 6/21/2024, driver went to make delivery to customer in University Park, IL. Driver could not get valves to open due to an issue with the air switches not fully opening the internal valve. This is when the trailer was brought to B&R for repairs. When the driver arrived at B&R he stopped and went into the office to check the trailer in, he came out and found HCL leaking from the pump cabinet onto the ground. Driver immediately went to seek out the source of the leak he found it to be leaking from a flange in the piping from the internal valve to the pump. He stopped the leak and began the neutralization process and reported it the repair shop. The repair shop helped the driver to neutralize the spill and clean it up. Driver estimated 5-8 gallons of hydrochloric acid 28% was lost. Trailer's leak was stopped, and the trailer was brought to a contained area to be pumped out. Once the trailer was emptied it was washed out and brought in for necessary repairs. It was found the secondary and internal valve failed. It was also found the flange gasket from the internal to the pump was the incorrect material.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and estimated that approximately five (5) gallons of material released due to five (5) 5-gallon metal pails that were crushed during transit. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and collected the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The five (5) damaged pails were placed into five 10-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

RESPONDER IN FULL PPE PLACED PACKAGE INTO CHEMICAL RESIST TRAY, RESPONDER ABSORBED SMALL PUDDLE ON FLOOR OF THE TRUCK WITH ZEP, RESPONDER HEADED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE WITH PACKAGE TO BE PROCESSED. 2. item.title: Report X-2024081307
item.description:
Report X-2024081307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A PUNGENT ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A SINGLE CURROGATED DIVIDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: Spill & exposure. Leaking box. One of 4x64oz plastic bottles Santeen Drain Cleaner lost 36oz from severe denting & loose cap closure. Spill occurred in spite of tape around caps & slotted partitions. Exposure: Package handler Jason Bowers, was exposed (skin contact on hands, no spotting or staining. Spillage released heat.) when attempting to remove package from IC belt. Package Handler Trainer Justin Hoeh had minor corrosion to undersides of shoes. Upon recommendation of Hoeh and Hall (DGNav reporter), the Work Area Manager ensured Bowers rinsed his hands for 10-15 min and continued follow up. Safety specialists have been notified.

item.title: Report I-2024080044
item.description:
Report I-2024080044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: LAKE HAVASU CITY
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ECOLOGY CONTROL INDUSTRIES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11th, 2024 I drove a load from Marathon Refinery in Carson, CA to Foreman, AR. When I reached Lake Havasa, AZ it was a temperature of 125 degrees F. I reached the truck stop Pilots in Lake Havasa to take a 30 minute break and did a trailer inspection on the trailer 1145. I noticed the trailer was leaking the product out of the top of the tank. I rushed to grab some trash cans that the truck stop had next to my trailer to catch any liquid that was draining down the side of the tank. I climbed up the ladder to inspect where the leak was coming from and noticed it was leaking from the ARV Valve and also had 40 PSI of pressure and nowhere to relieve the pressure from. I cleaned up the tank and kept an eye on it and waited for temps to cool down. Once the temps cooled down I was able to relieve the pressure from the domes by cracking one of the ears. All the pressure was relieved and the leak stopped and was contained until the HAZMAT team showed up at 0900 in the morning to clean up.
